page.title: 11The Sun Inn, Cottesmore
page.content: When we went to Cottesmore Village to sketch, quite a lot of people drew the Sun Inn. For example, Rachel Williams did it and so did Ginny. The Sun Inn has a very nice pattern on the top of the thatched roof. That pattern is called a scalloped pattern. In front of the Sun Inn there are three wooden tables and six benches, and a lot of flowers.Across the road there is the cottage that Mr. Williams drew. And nearly next to it there is the one that Simone drew.The first time that we went to visit Cottesmore village with our class(J.3.S) we had a drink (orange squash) and some sweets (Polos), outside of the Sun Inn, sitting on the wooden benches.The Sun Inn was built in the 17th and early 18th century They used to brew their own beer behind the Inn.
